schedule.title: Course Introduction
schedule.summary: 1. Syllabus and overview the course
schedule.resources: slides: [Administrivia and Cheating Policy], Handout, Recording

schedule.title: C Crash Course
schedule.summary: 2. Dive into C programming
schedule.resources: prelecture: [Intro to C Notes and Wade Lecture], Handout, Recording

schedule.title: Pointers and Structures
schedule.summary: 3. We are going to go over pointers in details
schedule.resources: prelecture: [ Gotcha Notes, Wade Lecture], Handout, Recording

schedule.title: Structures and I/O
schedule.summary: 4. We are going to go over C structs and I/O
schedule.resources: prelecture: [Heap Notes, Text I/O notes],Handout, Recording

schedule.title: File I/O
schedule.summary: 5. A little more on structs, c file io basics, posix file io, and scanf. Multidimensional arrays if we have time.
schedule.resources: prelecture: [File I/O notes], Handout, Recording, Please play with all the demos in the handouts

schedule.title: Processes
schedule.summary: 6. We are going to learn about processes, how to create them and the infamous fork, exec, wait paradigm
schedule.resources: prelecture: [Fork notes, Fork, Exec, Wait, Wade Lecture], Handout,

announcement: Pointers Gone Wild and Text Editor Released!

schedule.title: Labor day
schedule.summary: No classes

schedule.title: Forking Processes
schedule.summary: 7. The fork-exec-wait pattern

schedule.title: Signals for Process Control
schedule.summary: 8. Introducing POSIX signals to suspend and kill child processes. SIGSTOP, SIGKILL, SIGINT

announcement: Computerized Testing this Week! Quiz Coverage,Practice Quiz. Reserve seat, Testing Center Instructions

schedule.title: Thanks for the heap memory
schedule.summary: 9. How to build a memory allocator. Placement algorithms. Fragmentation. Buddy allocator

schedule.title: Memory allocators in C
schedule.summary: 10. Hone your pointer skills when writing malloc and free. Introducing realloc and calloc

schedule.title: Memory III. Intro to Threads
schedule.summary: 11. Introducing pthreads. stacks. Concurrency programming gotchas.

schedule.title: Threads and mutex locks
schedule.summary: 12. Introducing pthreads. stacks, shared memory. creating and joining. Concurrency programming gotchas.

schedule.title: Mutexes and semaphores
schedule.summary: 13. Why we need Mutex locks and semaphores. Basic usage of pthread implementations. Common gotchas.
schedule.resources: See wikibook week 5. Handout:pdf. Code:mutex code semaphore code

schedule.title: Critical Section Problem
schedule.summary: 14. Mutex and Semaphore examples. How to implement a lock (The critical section problem).

announcement: Reserve a seat for next week's quiz. Hint: Expect week 2-4 materials (process memory layout, process control, sending signals, requesting heap memory using malloc,calloc realloc). Practice quiz: pdf and test topics are here.

schedule.title: Critical Section Problem II
schedule.summary: 15. Incorrect attempts to solve the Critical Section Problem. Introduction to Condition Variables.

schedule.title: Condition Variables
schedule.summary: 16. Condition Variables. Implementing a semaphore using a Condition Variable.

schedule.title: Reader Writer Problem
schedule.summary: 17. Implementing a barrier. Implementing the R/W Problem using Condition Variables.

announcement: Reserve a seat for the optional practice midterm and the non-optional midterm exams (link). The midterm exam are 2 hour slots. Both exams will test your system programming skills..

schedule.title: Producer Consumer. RW II
schedule.summary: 18. Implementing the Producer Consumer using semaphores. Analysis of Reader Writer solutions.

schedule.title: Deadlock
schedule.summary: 19. Introduction to Deadlock. Coffman conditions.

schedule.title: Dining Philosophers
schedule.summary: 20. The Dining Philosophers problem

announcement: The practice midterm is this week (1hr). The real midterm is next week (2hr) (link). Both exams will test your system programming skills..

schedule.title: Review. Intro to memory
schedule.summary: Midterm AMA. Intro to virtual memory

schedule.title: Midterm
schedule.summary: (No lecture)
schedule.resources: See my email for exam topics.

schedule.title: Page tables
schedule.summary: 21. Virtual memory

announcement: Your real 2 hour midterm is this week (link). Check your email for details.

schedule.title: Pipes and Files
schedule.summary: 22. POSIX Pipes and random access files

schedule.title: Errno. Networking Intro
schedule.summary: 23. Robust error handling. EINTR. Intro to TCP,UDP,IP

schedule.title: TCP
schedule.summary: 24. TCP/IP Header. IPv4 exhaustion. A web client

announcement: Sign up for quiz 3 (link). A topic list will be posted here later this week.

schedule.title: TCP Server
schedule.summary: 25. Passive sockets. The 4 server calls and what they do. Gotchas.

schedule.title: TCP Server II
schedule.summary: 26. Socket Programming Gotchas. Intro to scheduling

schedule.title: Scheduling. TCP Handshake
schedule.summary: 27. Scheduling examples. The SYN ACKSYN ACK Handshake of TCP

schedule.title: Scheduling-2. epoll
schedule.summary: 28. Scott Fisher. Scheduling simulator. epoll

schedule.title: Files-1
schedule.summary: 29. ext2/3/4 filesystem. inode

schedule.title: Files-2
schedule.summary: 30. file meta data

announcement: Handouts are now in lecture_handouts. Lecture demos are now in lecture demos.

schedule.title: Files-3
schedule.summary: 31. Rob Kooper@NCSA. dirs and symlinks

schedule.title: Files-4
schedule.summary: 32. Virtual f/s

schedule.title: Files-5
schedule.summary: 33. Memory mapped files
